item.title: Roberta add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Montaigne
item.description: "When I am attacked by gloomy thoughts, nothing helps me so much as running to my books. They quickly absorb me and banish the clouds from my mind." -- Montaigne

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Roberta add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Do not meddle in the affairs of wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "On matters of style, swim with the current, on matters of principle, stand like a rock." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The will of the people is the only legitimate foundation of any government, and to protect its free expression should be our first object." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "Government exists to protect us from each other. Where government has gone beyond its limits is in deciding to protect us from ourselves." -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Roberta add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "When the eagles are silent, the parrots begin to jabber." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Roberta add a quote by George Lucas
item.description: "So this is how liberty dies. With thunderous applause." -- George Lucas
